TopicTitle: Is it just me or do the Atomic Rocket Engines burn fuel alot more faster then normal?

Articles.Content:
I took a 4 month break before 1.0 and Went to come back on. I started a career mode and I get all the tech and I have my Atomic Engines and I lift off to Duna and I get into orbit and I am starting my engines and i'm about to get to Duna and then I look at my engines and they are almost out completely! ...! The setup I use is getting a big Rockomax X200-32 tank and 4 FL-T200's. Sticking them on the side of the Rockomax X200-32 and getting 4 fuel lines and attaching them to the rocomax X200-32 tank to then engine. (Therefor ATON of gas) Did they change the fuel Consumption of the Atomic Engine? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T19:21:03Z" title="05/18/2015 07:21  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by Dspan\_000**
They only use LF now, not oxidizer. So if they did not change the total flow rate then they would now use LF about 2.22 times as fast.
Also, they changed the mass of the LV-N. It's heavier now (from 2.25t to 3t). So a simmilar setup pre-1.0 doesn't go as far as it used to.
